meanings.definition: To control the operations of; manage or govern.
meanings.sent1: She will direct the team to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will direct the students to line up for recess.
meanings.sent3: The boss will direct everyone to wear silly hats on Friday.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor will direct the chaotic situation towards order.
meanings.sent5: His clear instructions will direct us to success.

meanings.definition: To give authoritative instructions to; command; order or ordain.
meanings.sent1: The general will direct the soldiers to advance towards the enemy.
meanings.sent2: Please direct your attention to the front of the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef will direct the vegetables to dance in the pan.
meanings.sent4: Her powerful speech will direct the audience's emotions.
meanings.sent5: The conductor's baton will direct the orchestra's performance.

meanings.definition: To point, aim, or send toward a place or object.
meanings.sent1: He will direct the flashlight towards the dark corner.
meanings.sent2: Please direct your gaze to the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat will direct the laser pointer around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her words will direct attention to the important details.
meanings.sent5: The sign will direct travelers to the nearest gas station.

meanings.definition: To show the way to; guide; conduct.
meanings.sent1: The tour guide will direct us through the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent2: Can you direct me to the nearest post office?
meanings.sent3: The friendly robot will direct lost hikers back to the trail.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom will direct us towards making the right decision.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse will direct ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: To regulate the course of; control.
meanings.sent1: The thermostat will direct the temperature in the room.
meanings.sent2: The manager will direct the flow of customers in the store.
meanings.sent3: The traffic lights will direct vehicles to stop and go.
meanings.sent4: Her steady hand will direct the plane through turbulent skies.
meanings.sent5: The coach will direct the team's strategy for the game.
